ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The Council of the Borough of Kirklees

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The Council of the Borough of Kirklees

TITLE.P: Provision of Vehicle Body Repairs and Refurbishment Works

SHORT_DESCR.P: Tenders are invited by the contracting authority from economic operators with relevant experience and ability to demonstrate sufficient capacity for the provision of vehicle body repairs and refurbishment works to all vehicles in the contracting authority's fleet (the “Services”) under a proposed framework agreement.

TITLE.P: Lot 1 – Cars and Light Commercial Vehicles up to 7.5 tonnes excluding refuse vehicles

SHORT_DESCR.P: Cars and light commercial vehicles up to 7,5 t excluding refuse vehicles – To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service. Vehicle accident damage repairs shall include all inspections adjustments restoration and replacement of assemblies and components used to construct a complete vehicle, excluding structural repairs.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will initially run for a period of 24 months with the successful economic operator with the provision to extend the framework agreement by up to a maximum of two (2) 12 months extension periods.

TITLE.P: Lot 2 – Heavy Commercial Vehicles over 7.5 tonnes excluding refuse vehicles

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service. Vehicle accident damage repairs shall include all inspections adjustments restoration and replacement of assemblies and components used to construct a complete vehicle, excluding structural repairs.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will initially run for a period of 24 months with the successful economic operator with the provision to extend the framework agreement by up to a maximum of two (2) 12 months extension periods.

TITLE.P: Lot 3 — Refuse Trucks – To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service.

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service. Vehicle accident damage repairs shall include all inspections adjustments restoration and replacement of assemblies and components used to construct a complete vehicle, excluding structural repairs.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will initially run for a period of 24 months with the successful economic operator with the provision to extend the framework agreement by up to a maximum of two (2) 12 months extension periods.

TITLE.P: Lot 4 – Small to Medium Area Repair Techniques (SMART Repairs)

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service. Vehicle accident damage repairs shall include all inspections adjustments restoration and replacement of assemblies and components used to construct a complete vehicle. Using Small to Medium Area Repair Techniques (SMART), excluding structural repairs.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will initially run for a period of 24 months (24) with the successful economic operator with the provision to extend the framework agreement by up to a maximum of two (2) 12 months extension periods.

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a vehicle accident damage repair service. Vehicle accident damage repairs shall include all inspections adjustments restorations and replacement of assemblies and components used to construct a complete vehicle. Successful economic operators must either already have BS10125 accreditation or equivalent or be in a position to complete this accreditation within the first 6 months from the anticipated commencement date of the framework (i.e. 1.6.2018).

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will initially run for a period of 24 months with the successful economic operator with the provision to extend the framework agreement by up to a maximum of two (2) 12 months extension periods.

SUITABILITY.P: 1— Article 57 and 59 to 61 of Directive 2014/24/EU, and

Which require or permit the contracting authority not to select or to treat as ineligible, economic operators, the contracting authority reserves the right to exclude any economic operator whom they deem to not satisfy any criteria outlined within the scoring matrices contained within the Suppliers’ Submission Document (File 3.0), which is available to download at:
Or is available at the address set out in Section I.1 of this Notice.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Economic operators must be able to demonstrate financial standing as required under Section 4 of the Standard Selection Questionnaire (“SQ”) within Part A of the Suppliers’ Submission Document (File 3.0), which is available to download at:
Or is available at the address set out in Section I.1 of this notice.
Failure to supply any one of the financial sources requested under Section 4 of the SQ may result in exclusion.

Economic operators will either pass or fail on the basis of being financially viable for the Lots they have tendered for under the framework. The rationale applied will be the lead economic operator being able to demonstrate an annual turnover of at least one and a half (1.5) times the estimated annual total value of the Lot, or Lots, for which they have submitted a tender for.

Economic operators must be able to demonstrate that they have in place the insurances required under Section 8.1 of the SQ within Part A of the Suppliers’ Submission Document (File 3.0), which is available to download at:
Or is available at the address set out in Section I.1 of this Notice.

Economic operators are asked to self-certify whether they already have, or can commit to obtain, prior to the anticipated commencement date of the Framework (i.e. 1.6.2018), the levels of insurance cover indicated below:
a— employer's (compulsory) liability insurance – 10 000 000 GBP in relation to any one claim or series of claims, and
b— public/ products lability insurance – 10 000 000 GBP in relation to any one claim or series of claims.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The estimated annual values of each Lot under this Framework are follows:
— Lot 1: Cars and Light Commercial Vehicles up to 7,5 tonnes (excluding Refuse Vehicles & Structural Repairs) – 100 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 2: Heavy Commercial Vehicles over 7,5 tonnes (excluding Refuse Vehicles & Structural Repairs) – 40 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 3: Refuse Vehicles (excluding Structural Repairs) – 25 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 4: Small to Medium Area Repair Techniques (SMART Repairs) (excluding Structural Repairs) –30 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 5: Structural Repairs – 55 000 GBP per annum.
• economic operators bidding for Lot 1 must demonstrate a minimum annual turnover of at least 150 000 GBP;
• economic operators bidding for Lot 2 must demonstrate a minimum annual turnover of at least 60 000 GBP;
• economic operators bidding for Lot 3 must demonstrate a minimum annual turnover of at least 37 500 GBP;
• economic operators bidding for Lot 4 must demonstrate a minimum annual turnover of at least 45 000 GBP.
• economic operators bidding for Lot 5 must demonstrate a minimum annual turnover of at least 82 500 GBP.

Economic operators wishing to cover more than one Lot will need to demonstrate an aggregated minimum annual turnover. For example, if an economic operators is bidding for both Lots 1 and 2 the minimum turnover required would be 210 000 GBP to Pass.
Failure to indicate “Yes” in response to Section 8.1 of the SQ will result in exclusion.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Economic operators are asked to provide evidence of relevant experience and references in accordance with the requirements set out within Section 6 of the SQ within Part A of the Suppliers’ submission document (File 3.0), which is available to download at:
Or is available at the address set out in Section I.1 of this notice.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Pass – The economic operator has provided Either:

1— at least one (1) example of a previous contract that meets the minimum requirements set out in Section 6, and demonstrates to the reasonable satisfaction of the contracting authority that the economic operator possesses the relevant general technical expertise and professional experience to be entrusted with the relevant services under the contracting authority’s Framework;

2— a satisfactory reason as to why the applicant is unable to provide any examples of previous contracts that are relevant to the contracting authority’s requirements under this procurement that meets the minimum requirements set out in Question 6.3 of the SQ.
However, economic operators are asked to note that:

i— If they need to use more than one (1) example to demonstrate that they possess the relevant general technical expertise and professional experience, they may do so up to a maximum of three 3— examples.
ii— The contracting authority reserves the right to confirm the accuracy of any information provided in response to Section 6 of the SQ with any named customer contact(s).

iii— Any replies from any named customer contact(s) which lead the contracting authority, acting reasonably, to doubt any significant representations made in your responses to Section 6 of the SQ may result in exclusion.
1— has failed to provide any examples of any previous contracts in response to Section 6 of the SQ, AND has failed to provide a satisfactory reason as to why they were unable to provide any examples;

2— the examples given in response to Section 6 of the SQ do NOT demonstrate to the satisfaction of the contracting authority that the economic operator possesses the relevant general technical expertise and professional experience to be entrusted with the relevant services under the contracting authority’s Framework.

INFO_ADD.P: At least one (1) representative from Finance Management, Risk Performance and IT and one (1) Corporate Procurement Officer will open and record the electronic (and where applicable, written) quotations received by the appointed time at the same time.
The Framework has been divided into 5 Lots:
— Lot 1: Cars and Light Commercial Vehicles up to 7.5 tonnes (excluding Refuse Vehicles & Structural Repairs) – 100 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 2: Heavy Commercial Vehicles over 7.5 tonnes (excluding Refuse Vehicles & Structural Repairs) – 40 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 3: Refuse Vehicles (excluding Structural Repairs) – 25 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 4: Small to Medium Area Repair Techniques (SMART Repairs) (excluding Structural Repairs) – 30 000 GBP per annum;
— Lot 5: Structural Repairs – 55 000 GBP per annum.

A maximum of 5 economic operators will be appointed to each Lot. Economic operators can tender for one or all of the above Lots. There will be no limitation to the number of Lots awarded to any 1 Supplier.

The contracting authority considers that this framework may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (‘SMEs’). However, any selection of economic operators will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement, and the framework will be awarded to the most economically advantageous tender for each Lot.

Economic operators should note that any stated annual contract values in this Notice and/or the procurement documentation are estimates and given for information and guidance only, and that the contracting authority shall not be bound by such estimates. Further, economic operators should note however that for the avoidance of any doubt:-.
— the contracting authority is not bound to place any orders under any of the Lots under the framework; and
— the contracting authority is not bound to enter into any other specific contracts under this framework following discussions or any other representations; and

— the contracting authority shall not incur any liability in respect of any failure to place any order(s) or in connection with the total volume of Services, type of services, or value of services anticipated by the economic operators, or which the successful economic operators may be asked to carry out.
The procurement documentation can be found at: https://www.YORtender.co.uk/procontract/supplier.nsf

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of England and Wales

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The contracting authority will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar days standstill period at the point that information on the conclusion of the framework is communicated to tenderers. This period allows any unsuccessful tenderer(s) to seek further debriefing from the contracting authority before the conclusion of the contract. Such additional information should be requested from the address at 1.1 of this Notice. If an appeal regarding the conclusion of the framework has not been successfully resolved, then the public contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland). Any such action must be stated within thirty (30) days beginning with the date when the aggrieved party first knew or sought to have grounds for starting the proceedings had risen. The court may extend the time limited for starting proceedings where the Court considers that there is a good reason for doing so, but not so as to permit proceedings to be started more than 3 months after that date. Where the framework has not been concluded, the Court may order the setting aside of the award decision or order the contracting authority to amend any document and may award damages. If however the framework has been concluded, the Court may only award damages or, where the contract award procedures have not been followed correctly, declare the framework to be ineffective.
